Dr. Goodwin:

Thank you for your prompt response.

After review of your suggestion I investigated further.  The path
specified in the error is not governed by the location of the demo
files, but rather the location of my active temporary file.  This is
set by the OS Environment Variables.  That said, I changed my TEMP 
variables to point to c:\tmpdir instead of in my long named profile
directory.  However, this did not correct the error.

In which ever temp directory is specified there are 2 files generated
before the error stops the program.   They are:
.cttmp1100848520.pyw
.check1100848520.pyw
The the contents and resulta of attempting to run these files is show
below.  The .cttmp##.pyw file will successfully generate the file
gri30.xml when initiated by the cmd prompt.   However the .check##.pyw
errors out.

Are there additional steps I should attempt towards resolving this
issue?  

I appreaciate your assistance.

-tom

---Running gennerated files from DOS prompt --------start----------
Microsoft Windows XP [Version 5.1.2600]
(C) Copyright 1985-2001 Microsoft Corp.

C:\Documents and Settings\tps>python c:\tmpdir\.cttmp1100848520.pyw

C:\Documents and Settings\tps>python c:\tmpdir\.check1100848520.pyw
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "c:\tmpdir\.check1100848520.pyw", line 1, in ?
    from Cantera import ctml_writer
ImportError: cannot import name ctml_writer

C:\Documents and Settings\tps>
----Running gennerated files from DOS prompt -----------end----------

-------- Contents of .cttmp1100848520.pyw -----------------
from ctml_writer import *
import sys, os, os.path
file = "C:\Program Files\Common Files/Cantera/data/gri30.cti"
base = os.path.basename(file)
root, ext = os.path.splitext(base)
dataset(root)
execfile(file)
write()
-------------end .cttmp1100848520.pyw --------------------

------- Contents of .check1100848520.pyw -------------
from Cantera import ctml_writer
------------End .check1100848520.pyw-------------------



--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@c...> wrote:
> Tom - I'm not sure, but if I were to guess, I would guess that
Python 
> is not finding the temporary Python script Cantera generates to
process 
> CTI input files.  Judging from the pathname that appears in the
error 
> message "C:\DOCUME~1\tps\LOCALS~1\Temp/" it looks like you are
running 
> the demos from a directory with a long name, probably containing 
> spaces.  Try copying the demos to a directory with a name that 
> Windows/DOS does not mangle, or at least not as badly (short with
no 
> spaces). If that doesn't work, try running the temporary Python
script 
> manually, and look for error messages - for example, type at a
command 
> prompt:
> 
> python .check1100822275.pyw
> 
> Hope this helps.
> 
> Dave
> 
> 
>

have
